main event: A bright object was observed in the sky, described as a twinkling star with helicopter-like motion on the evening of 17-18 January 1956.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for approximately 15 minutes,The object was reported to have moved to the northwest and disappeared below the horizon,It was suggested that the sighting may have been an astronomical object or possibly a balloon or aircraft,Similar observations were reported on the succeeding nights,The object appeared to twinkle occasionally during its movement.
sighted object: a bright object resembling a twinkling star
witness description: 45-year-old car warehouse employee at Stewart AFB, formerly a Sergeant at SAFE, Newburgh, NY
